quiz_data.question: Who won the Premier League title in the 2019-2020 season?
quiz_data.explanation: Liverpool won their first Premier League title in the 2019-2020 season, ending their 30-year-long wait for a top-flight championship. Manchester City finished as the runners-up.

quiz_data.question: Which player has won the most Premier League Golden Boot awards?
quiz_data.explanation: Alan Shearer has won the Premier League Golden Boot award three times (in the seasons 1994-95, 1995-96, and 1996-97). Thierry Henry, Sergio Agüero, and Harry Kane have all won it twice.

quiz_data.question: Which team has won the most consecutive Premier League titles?
quiz_data.explanation: Manchester United won the Premier League title for three consecutive seasons from 1998-1999 to 2000-2001. They achieved this feat under the management of Sir Alex Ferguson.

quiz_data.question: Which team holds the record for the most points in a single Premier League season?
quiz_data.explanation: Manchester City holds the record for the most points in a single Premier League season with a total of 100 points in the 2017-2018 season. They surpassed the previous record of 95 points set by Chelsea in the 2004-2005 season.
